not getting a table works for some things.

When I ran a vB community, I created several forums (equivalent of groups, here) for specific topics, so that topical discussions would be neatly organized. I thought it was intuitive. Turns out, communities don't work that way at all, humans don't behave like neatly organized beings. Many grouped together in the "general chat" forum, and that's where most discussions took place, even those about topics I had dedicated forums for.

Django people will hang in the Django group, and discuss whatever topic they want to discuss—django related or otherwise. Same will be for most every other community that comes in here en-masse as a community.
People will naturally gravitate towards where they feel "their" friends hang out, or at least, the people they want to talk with and to.
